entities.name: fr ed
entities.description: Fr ed is mentioned as leaving Harry with some Nifflers in his office.

entities.name: george
entities.description: George is mentioned as leaving Harry with some Nifflers in his office.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is the main character and is mentioned throughout the conversation.

entities.name: dean
entities.description: Dean is mentioned as saying that Umbridge would have sacked Dumbledore anyway.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as being close to Umbridge.

entities.name: lavender
entities.description: Lavender is mentioned as being tearful about Professor McGonagall's condition.

entities.name: colin creevey
entities.description: Colin Creevey is mentioned as watching through the dormitory window and seeing Professor McGonagall being carried back to the castle.

entities.name: madam pomfrey
entities.description: Madam Pomfrey is mentioned as being able to sort out Professor McGonagall's condition.

entities.name: alicia spinnet
entities.description: Alicia Spinnet is mentioned as saying that Madam Pomfrey will be able to sort out Professor McGonagall.

entities.name: umbridge
entities.description: Umbridge is mentioned as being the target of Harry's anger and Ron's suggestion for punishment.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is mentioned as suggesting a punishment for Umbridge.

entities.name: hagrid
entities.description: Hagrid is mentioned as sprinting away into the dark and haunting Harry's image.

entities.name: professor mcgonagall
entities.description: Professor McGonagall is mentioned as being carried back to the castle and not looking well.

entities.name: nifflers
entities.description: Nifflers are mentioned as being levitated into Umbridge's office by Harry.

relationships.description: Harry is angry with Umbridge and wants to punish her.
Ron suggests that Umbridge should be fed to a box of starving Blast-Ended Skrewts as punishment.
Madam Pomfrey is able to sort out Professor McGonagall's condition.
Colin Creevey watches through the dormitory window and sees Professor McGonagall being carried back to the castle.
